page.title: 03Landscape of Beacon Hill
page.content: Beacon Hill lies to the south of Wolverhampton. It is nearly 230 metres high and has very steep slopes. It is the highest piece of land near to Wolverhampton. It gets its name from when a bonfire was lit on top of it to warn people that something had happened. The last time one was lit was for the Queeens Silver Jubilee. The towns radio station has been named after the hill. It is called Beacon Radio. Also, there is an institute for the blind on the lower slopes called Beacon House. The hill is used to supply the town with water. Hidden in the top of the hill is a reservoir. Water is pumped into the reservoir then flows through pipes under the influence of gravity to all the homes in the town.
